item.description:
Pleasant Valley Preserve in Lyme, CT This hike is about 3 miles long. There is a hill on this hike. We will meet in the parking lot, which the website says is on Macintosh Rd. about 300 yards from Rt. 156 in Lyme.

We will meet at 10:00am.

HwD Operating Principles - please click to read.



The trail map: http://www.lymelandtrust.org/web_docs/prop_pleasant_valley.pdf

Directions:
Map: http://maps.google.com/maps?f=d&source=s_d&saddr=&daddr=41.413188,-72.340572
&hl=en&geocode=&mra=mi&mrsp=0&sz=16&sll=41.412248,
-72.341538&sspn=0.007322,0.012832&g=MacIntosh+Road,
+lyme+ct&ie=UTF8&t=h&z=16


From Interstate 95 north or south: Take exit 70 and follow Route 156 north, driving 6.6 miles and entering Lyme. Just before the grade school, town hall and library, turn left onto MacIntosh Road. At the first sharp bend in road (just past bridge), park at the dirt road on right. The trail begins at the gate. Follow woods road, bear right to stream and preserve sign (about a quarter mile). 

Lost or Late? Call / SMS Fred at 860-227-4027
item.how_to_find_us: Fred will be there in his Royal Bleu Oriental Gas-Powered Rickshaw.
